titles: To the Kings most excellent Majesty. Your Maiesties loyall, and peaceable subiects, the barronets, knights, esquires, free-holders, and other inhabitants of the county and town of Derby. Humbly crave leave, to shew and pray, as followeth.
notes: A petition to the King to return to and reside near the Parliament.
Reproduction of original in: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, University of California, Los Angeles.
keywords: Derbyshire (England) --  History --  17th century --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
